channel.title: Unsupported look and feel
channel.description: I know, this means its a windows-only app at the moment, I'm just wondering if there is a fix for this (wine is installed, but says its not, so I'm still debugging that). [code=Error] javax.swing.UnsupportedLookAndFeelException: [The Microsoft Windows Look and Feel - com.sun.java.swing.plaf.windows.WindowsLookAndFeel] not support on this platform Exception in thread "main" java.land.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0 at ChatClient.Main(ChatClient.java:240) [/code] Should I just re-do my Ubuntu and try getting wine again? Or, is there a minor-bug and/or fix for this.

item.title: Unsupported look and feel
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

CoonHunter:

Requesting lock -.-

We don’t lock threads on request, just if there is an absolute need to. Just letting you know.

Also it doesn’t hurt to have multiple ways to do the same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Unsupported look and feel
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Seriously, this has been answered countless times. Was no need to re-do what others have said

Requesting lock -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Unsupported look and feel
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:6, topic:346202”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=442584.msg3250342#msg3250342 date=1277695947]

[quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=442584.msg3250301#msg3250301 date=1277692033]

Take out where it is explicitly setting the windows LAF.

ie the .setLookAndFeel() call or similar
[/quote]I think he wants to keep the Windows LAF, but make it run on Linux under wine.

OP, are you running Java from within wine?

Actually i just wanted it to be OS friendly between windows and linux.
[/quote]Oh, in that case, follow what Mopman said.[/quote]

Yea, the only reason I had initially said anything about wine, was because I had thought about running with it instead. Then after I talked to alot of my friends, most of them have Linux and Windows dual-booting.

Read full topic

ie the .setLookAndFeel() call or similar
[/quote]I think he wants to keep the Windows LAF, but make it run on Linux under wine.

Actually i just wanted it to be OS friendly between windows and linux.[/quote]Oh, in that case, follow what Mopman said.

item.title: Unsupported look and feel
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I know, this means its a windows-only app at the moment, I’m just wondering if there is a fix for this (wine is installed, but says its not, so I’m still debugging that).

javax.swing.UnsupportedLookAndFeelException: [The Microsoft Windows Look and Feel - com.sun.java.swing.plaf.windows.WindowsLookAndFeel] not support on this platform
Exception in thread "main" java.land.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
            at ChatClient.Main(ChatClient.java:240)

Should I just re-do my Ubuntu and try getting wine again? Or, is there a minor-bug and/or fix for this.

Read full topic
